length: length calculation algorithms


Functions

template<typename IT , typename S >
double geometry::length (IT begin, IT end, S const &strategy)
 Calculate length of a series of points, specified by an iterator pair and a strategy.
template<typename IT >
double geometry::length (IT begin, IT end)
 Calculate length of a series of points, specified by an iterator pair.

Detailed Description

The length algorithm is implemented for the linestring and the multi_linestring geometry and results in the length of the linestring. If the points of a linestring have coordinates expressed in kilometers, the length of the line is expressed in kilometers as well.

Function Documentation

template<typename IT , typename S >
double geometry::length ( IT  begin,
IT  end,
S const &  strategy 
)

Calculate length of a series of points, specified by an iterator pair and a strategy.

The function length returns the length of a point container between specified iterators, using specified strategy

Parameters:
begin iterator positioned at first point
end iterator positioned after last point
strategy strategy to be used for distance calculations.
Returns:
the length
Example:
Example showing length calculation using iterators and the Vincenty strategy 
{
        using namespace geometry;
        typedef point_ll<degree, float> LL;
        std::deque<LL> line;
        geometry::from_wkt<LL>("linestring(0 51,1 51,2 52)", std::back_inserter(line));
        std::cout << "linestring length is "
                << 0.001 * geometry::length(line.begin(), line.end(), geometry::strategy::distance::vincenty<LL>())
                << " kilometers" << std::endl;
}
Examples:
5_distance_example.cpp.

template<typename IT >
double geometry::length ( IT  begin,
IT  end 
)

Calculate length of a series of points, specified by an iterator pair.

The function length returns the length of a point container, using the default distance-calculation-strategy

Parameters:
begin iterator positioned at first point
end iterator positioned after last point
Returns:
the length
Example:
Example showing length calculation using iterators 
{
        geometry::linestring<geometry::point_xy<double> > line;
        geometry::from_wkt("linestring(0 0,1 1,4 8,3 2)", line);
        std::cout << "linestring length is "
                << geometry::length(line.begin(), line.end())
                << " units" << std::endl;
}
Example showing length calculation on a vector 
{
        std::vector<geometry::point_xy<double> > line;
        geometry::from_wkt<geometry::point_xy<double> >("linestring(0 0,1 1,4 8,3 2)", std::back_inserter(line));
        std::cout << "linestring length is "
                << geometry::length(line.begin(), line.end())
                << " units" << std::endl;
}
Examples:
3_linestring_example.cpp.
